Issues.Title: Adding Cyclic LR scheduling for Image Classification API
Issues.Body:
This PR implements Cyclic Learning rate scheduler. The following paper has more information.
https://arxiv.org/abs/1506.01186

Also added unit test and integration test for the same.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Adding Cyclic LR scheduling for Image Classification API " (#4564)

Issues.Title: add document for method ChnageModelThreshold
Issues.Body:
Fixes issue #4527 , add documentation for public method ChnageModelThreshold.

This method is introduced in #2969
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "add document for method ChnageModelThreshold" (#4563)

Issues.Title: Added onnx export support for SlotsDroppingTransformer
Issues.Body:
This work required the use of ConstantOfShape operator from onnx which has an attribute of type Tensor. Most operators have attributes that are of primitive types (int, float, etc). ML.NET Onnx converter coded didnt have support to add attributes of tensor types. 
Therefore this PR includes the support for adding tensor type attributes along with the necessary code and tests for SlotsDroppingTransformer.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Added onnx export support for SlotsDroppingTransformer" (#4562)

Issues.Title: Format error in GetFormattedConfusionTable"
Issues.Body:
Hey,

I'm trying to print a confusion matrix on a binary classification model using:

`Console.WriteLine("Confusion Matrix:\n{0}", metrics.ConfusionMatrix.GetFormattedConfusionTable());
`

I get:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1317234/70378656-e3f8f380-18d7-11ea-8e96-e96fea095059.png)

Shouldn‚Äôt there be a comma here instead of a space?

Charles
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Format error in GetFormattedConfusionTable"" (#4542)

Version: 1.4.0

But now there is no way to access `EvaluateWithPRCurve`.

Issues.Title: ImageClassification training stops
Issues.Body:
### System information

- **.NET Version .NET Core 3.0**: 

### Issue

- **What did you do?**
Trying to train MulticlassClassification with dataset of 2096 images and 8 classes
- **What happened?**
Training just stops at one point in the Fit() method. It never exits the method.
No exeptions as well.
When I reduce the number images for example to 1100, then training successfuly ends.
And it doesn't seem to make any difference witch images I remove.

### Source code / logs
This is the last log in the output window. After that CPU activity remains high for few seconds and 
then drops to 0.

Phase: Bottleneck Computation, Dataset used: Validation, Image Index: 405
Phase: Bottleneck Computation, Dataset used: Validation, Image Index: 406
Phase: Bottleneck Computation, Dataset used: Validation, Image Index: 407

Issues.Title: Convert LdaEngine to a SafeHandle
Issues.Body:
This pull request follows the test failure observed in https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/public/_build/results?buildId=449759&view=ms.vss-test-web.build-test-results-tab&runId=14347330&resultId=100770&paneView=debug. Converting this object to a SafeHandle has two primary advantages:

1. The object will not be disposed while there is an ongoing native call
2. Misuse of the object by trying to pass an invalid instance to a native call will throw an exception at the point of the call
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Convert LdaEngine to a SafeHandle" (#4538)

Issues.Title: AutoML Nuget Package won't train against TSV
Issues.Body:
### System information

- **OS version/distro**: Win10 64bit
- **.NET Version (eg., dotnet --info)**: 
dotnet core 3.0

### Issue

- **What did you do?** 
Installed AutoML nuget package. Setup sentiment analysis training. Selected correct labels and features columns. 

Went to train and... 

- **What happened?**

I got a message almost immediately "Failed. See more in Output pane". 

The output pane for "Machine Learning" is completely empty! 

- **What did you expect?**
At least an error... 

screenshot:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4026553/70447947-814e5600-1a97-11ea-8515-6c53bd2c77c7.png)

Here's the input data pane: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4026553/70448245-fe79cb00-1a97-11ea-8040-79b9deeccb83.png)



### Source code / logs

Please paste or attach the code or logs or traces that would be helpful to diagnose the issue you are reporting.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "AutoML Nuget Package won't train against TSV" (#4555)

Issues.Title: WIP Safe pointers
Issues.Body:
Locally I converted most owned native objects to `std::unique_ptr` and `std::shared_ptr`. This pull request represents a relatively easy-to-review subset of the changes with minimal overall fan-out in the code.

* Pass by reference when null is not expected (submitted separately as #4546)
* Use `std::unique_ptr` for objects in `LdaEngine` (submitted separately as #4547)
* Use `std::unique_ptr` for `samplers_` and `likelihood_in_iter_`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "WIP Safe pointers" (#4544)

Issues.Title: Use std::unique_ptr for objects in LdaEngine
Issues.Body: Builds on #4546
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Use std::unique_ptr for objects in LdaEngine" (#4547)

Issues.Title: Prevent exceptions from escaping FileSystemWatcher events
Issues.Body:
Exceptions in the handler of FileSystemWatcher events will terminate the process. This pull request updates the event handler to use a try/catch block that logs the error instead of crashing the process.

This fixes one known cause of test process failures.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Prevent exceptions from escaping FileSystemWatcher events" (#4535)

Issues.Title: Increase the code coverage run timeout
Issues.Body: Most of the code coverage runs are timing out. Increase the timeout to match the value used for non-code-coverage builds.

Issues.Title: Update Microsoft.Extensions.* to 3.0.1
Issues.Body:
The 3.0 release includes a fix to cases where `ChangeToken.OnChange` would not unregister callbacks even when disposed.

See aspnet/Extensions#558, aspnet/Extensions#869
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Update Microsoft.Extensions.* to 3.0.1" (#4536)
